AndroidDeviceInfo.description: User Android device information, if an Android device has been linked

AppleAccountInfo.description: Sign in with Apple account information, if an Apple account has been linked

Created.description: Timestamp indicating when the user account was created

CustomIdInfo.description: Custom ID information, if a custom ID has been assigned

FacebookInfo.description: User Facebook information, if a Facebook account has been linked

FacebookInstantGamesIdInfo.description: Facebook Instant Games account information, if a Facebook Instant Games account has been linked

GameCenterInfo.description: User Gamecenter information, if a Gamecenter account has been linked

GoogleInfo.description: User Google account information, if a Google account has been linked

GooglePlayGamesInfo.description: User Google Play Games account information, if a Google Play Games account has been linked

IosDeviceInfo.description: User iOS device information, if an iOS device has been linked

KongregateInfo.description: User Kongregate account information, if a Kongregate account has been linked

NintendoSwitchAccountInfo.description: Nintendo Switch account information, if a Nintendo Switch account has been linked

NintendoSwitchDeviceIdInfo.description: Nintendo Switch device information, if a Nintendo Switch device has been linked

OpenIdInfo.description: OpenID Connect information, if any OpenID Connect accounts have been linked

PlayFabId.description: Unique identifier for the user account

PrivateInfo.description: Personal information for the user which is considered more sensitive

PsnInfo.description: User PlayStation :tm: Network account information, if a PlayStation :tm: Network account has been linked

SteamInfo.description: User Steam information, if a Steam account has been linked

TitleInfo.description: Title-specific information for the user account

TwitchInfo.description: User Twitch account information, if a Twitch account has been linked

Username.description: User account name in the PlayFab service

XboxInfo.description: User XBox account information, if a XBox account has been linked

UserDataPermission.description: Indicates whether a given data key is private (readable only by the player) or public (readable by all players). When a player makes a GetUserData request about another player, only keys marked Public will be returned.

LastUpdated.description: Timestamp for when this data was last updated.

Permission.description: Indicates whether this data can be read by all users (public) or only the user (private). This is used for GetUserData requests being made by one player about another player.

Value.description: Data stored for the specified user data key.

GoogleEmail.description: Email address of the Google account

GoogleGender.description: Gender information of the Google account

GoogleName.description: Name of the Google account user

GooglePlayGamesPlayerAvatarImageUrl.description: Avatar image url of the Google Play Games player

GooglePlayGamesPlayerDisplayName.description: Display name of the Google Play Games player

GatherDeviceInfo.description: Boolean for whether this player is eligible for gathering device info.

GatherFocusInfo.description: Boolean for whether this player should report OnFocus play-time tracking.

NeedsAttribution.description: Boolean for whether this player is eligible for ad tracking.

SteamActivationStatus.description: what stage of game ownership the user is listed as being in, from Steam

SteamCountry.description: the country in which the player resides, from Steam data

SteamCurrency.description: currency type set in the user Steam account

Created.description: timestamp indicating when the user was first associated with this game (this can differ significantly from when the user first registered with PlayFab)

DisplayName.description: name of the user, as it is displayed in-game

FirstLogin.description: timestamp indicating when the user first signed into this game (this can differ from the Created timestamp, as other events, such as issuing a beta key to the user, can associate the title to the user)

isBanned.description: boolean indicating whether or not the user is currently banned for a title

LastLogin.description: timestamp for the last user login for this title

Origination.description: source by which the user first joined the game, if known

TitlePlayerAccount.description: Title player account entity for this user

Currency.description: ISO 4217 code of the currency used in the purchases

TotalValue.description: Total value of the purchases in a whole number of 1/100 monetary units. For example, 999 indicates nine dollars and ninety-nine cents when Currency is 'USD')

TotalValueAsDecimal.description: Total value of the purchases in a string representation of decimal monetary units. For example, '9.99' indicates nine dollars and ninety-nine cents when Currency is 'USD'.

RechargeMax.description: Maximum value to which the regenerating currency will automatically increment. Note that it can exceed this value through use of the AddUserVirtualCurrency API call. However, it will not regenerate automatically until it has fallen below this value.

RechargeTime.description: Server timestamp in UTC indicating the next time the virtual currency will be incremented.

SecondsToRecharge.description: Time remaining (in seconds) before the next recharge increment of the virtual currency.

EventId.description: The unique identifier of the event. The values of this identifier consist of ASCII characters and are not constrained to any particular format.

WriteServerCharacterEventRequest.description: This API is designed to write a multitude of different event types into PlayStream. It supports a flexible JSON schema, which allowsfor arbitrary key-value pairs to describe any character-based event. The created event will be locked to the authenticated title.

Body.description: Custom event properties. Each property consists of a name (string) and a value (JSON object).

CharacterId.description: Unique PlayFab assigned ID for a specific character owned by a user

CustomTags.description: The optional custom tags associated with the request (e.g. build number, external trace identifiers, etc.).

EventName.description: The name of the event, within the namespace scoped to the title. The naming convention is up to the caller, but it commonly follows the subject_verb_object pattern (e.g. player_logged_in).

PlayFabId.description: Unique PlayFab assigned ID of the user on whom the operation will be performed.

Timestamp.description: The time (in UTC) associated with this event. The value defaults to the current time.

WriteServerPlayerEventRequest.description: This API is designed to write a multitude of different event types into PlayStream. It supports a flexible JSON schema, which allowsfor arbitrary key-value pairs to describe any player-based event. The created event will be locked to the authenticated title.

Body.description: Custom data properties associated with the event. Each property consists of a name (string) and a value (JSON object).

CustomTags.description: The optional custom tags associated with the request (e.g. build number, external trace identifiers, etc.).

EventName.description: The name of the event, within the namespace scoped to the title. The naming convention is up to the caller, but it commonly follows the subject_verb_object pattern (e.g. player_logged_in).

PlayFabId.description: Unique PlayFab assigned ID of the user on whom the operation will be performed.

Timestamp.description: The time (in UTC) associated with this event. The value defaults to the current time.

WriteTitleEventRequest.description: This API is designed to write a multitude of different event types into PlayStream. It supports a flexible JSON schema, which allowsfor arbitrary key-value pairs to describe any title-based event. The created event will be locked to the authenticated title.

Body.description: Custom event properties. Each property consists of a name (string) and a value (JSON object).

CustomTags.description: The optional custom tags associated with the request (e.g. build number, external trace identifiers, etc.).

EventName.description: The name of the event, within the namespace scoped to the title. The naming convention is up to the caller, but it commonly follows the subject_verb_object pattern (e.g. player_logged_in).

Timestamp.description: The time (in UTC) associated with this event. The value defaults to the current time.

PlayFabId.description: Unique PlayFab identifier for a user, or null if no PlayFab account is linked to the Xbox Live identifier.

XboxLiveAccountId.description: Unique Xbox Live identifier for a user.

AddPlayerTagRequest.name: AddPlayerTagRequest
AddPlayerTagRequest.description: This API will trigger a player_tag_added event and add a tag with the given TagName and PlayFabID to the corresponding player profile. TagName can be used for segmentation and it is limited to 256 characters. Also there is a limit on the number of tags a title can have.

AuthenticateSessionTicketRequest.name: AuthenticateSessionTicketRequest
AuthenticateSessionTicketRequest.description: Note that data returned may be Personally Identifying Information (PII), such as email address, and so care should be taken in how this data is stored and managed. Since this call will always return the relevant information for users who have accessed the title, the recommendation is to not store this data locally.

BanUsersRequest.name: BanUsersRequest
BanUsersRequest.description: The existence of each user will not be verified. When banning by IP or MAC address, multiple players may be affected, so use this feature with caution. Returns information about the new bans.

CreateSharedGroupRequest.name: CreateSharedGroupRequest
CreateSharedGroupRequest.description: If SharedGroupId is specified, the service will attempt to create a group with that identifier, and will return an error if it is already in use. If no SharedGroupId is specified, a random identifier will be assigned.

DeleteCharacterFromUserRequest.name: DeleteCharacterFromUserRequest
DeleteCharacterFromUserRequest.description: This function will delete the specified character from the list allowed by the user, and will also delete any inventory or VC currently held by that character. It will NOT delete any statistics associated for this character, in order to preserve leaderboard integrity.

DeletePlayerRequest.name: DeletePlayerRequest
DeletePlayerRequest.description: Deletes all data associated with the player, including statistics, custom data, inventory, purchases, virtual currency balances, characters and shared group memberships. Removes the player from all leaderboards and player search indexes. Does not delete PlayStream event history associated with the player. Does not delete the publisher user account that created the player in the title nor associated data such as username, password, email address, account linkages, or friends list. Note, this API queues the player for deletion and returns immediately. It may take several minutes or more before all player data is fully deleted. Until the player data is fully deleted, attempts to recreate the player with the same user account in the same title will fail with the 'AccountDeleted' error. This API must be enabled for use as an option in the game manager website. It is disabled by default.

DeletePushNotificationTemplateRequest.name: DeletePushNotificationTemplateRequest
DeletePushNotificationTemplateRequest.description: Represents the request to delete a push notification template.

GetCharacterDataRequest.name: GetCharacterDataRequest
GetCharacterDataRequest.description: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

GetCharacterInventoryRequest.name: GetCharacterInventoryRequest
GetCharacterInventoryRequest.description: All items currently in the character inventory will be returned, irrespective of how they were acquired (via purchasing, grants, coupons, etc.). Items that are expired, fully consumed, or are no longer valid are not considered to be in the user's current inventory, and so will not be not included. Also returns their virtual currency balances.

GetCharacterStatisticsRequest.name: GetCharacterStatisticsRequest
GetCharacterStatisticsRequest.description: Character statistics are similar to user statistics in that they are numeric values which may only be updated by a server operation, in order to minimize the opportunity for unauthorized changes. In addition to being available for use by the title, the statistics are used for all leaderboard operations in PlayFab.

GetPlayerProfileRequest.name: GetPlayerProfileRequest
GetPlayerProfileRequest.description: This API allows for access to details regarding a user in the PlayFab service, usually for purposes of customer support. Note that data returned may be Personally Identifying Information (PII), such as email address, and so care should be taken in how this data is stored and managed. Since this call will always return the relevant information for users who have accessed the title, the recommendation is to not store this data locally.

GetPlayersInSegmentRequest.name: GetPlayersInSegmentRequest
GetPlayersInSegmentRequest.description: Initial request must contain at least a Segment ID. Subsequent requests must contain the Segment ID as well as the Continuation Token. Failure to send the Continuation Token will result in a new player segment list being generated. Each time the Continuation Token is passed in the length of the Total Seconds to Live is refreshed. If too much time passes between requests to the point that a subsequent request is past the Total Seconds to Live an error will be returned and paging will be terminated. This API is resource intensive and should not be used in scenarios which might generate high request volumes. Only one request to this API at a time should be made per title. Concurrent requests to the API may be rejected with the APIConcurrentRequestLimitExceeded error.

GetPlayerTagsRequest.name: GetPlayerTagsRequest
GetPlayerTagsRequest.description: This API will return a list of canonical tags which includes both namespace and tag's name. If namespace is not provided, the result is a list of all canonical tags. TagName can be used for segmentation and Namespace is limited to 128 characters.

GetPublisherDataRequest.name: GetPublisherDataRequest
GetPublisherDataRequest.description: This API is designed to return publisher-specific values which can be read, but not written to, by the client. This data is shared across all titles assigned to a particular publisher, and can be used for cross-game coordination. Only titles assigned to a publisher can use this API. For more information email helloplayfab@microsoft.com. Note that there may up to a minute delay in between updating title data and this API call returning the newest value.

GetStoreItemsServerRequest.name: GetStoreItemsServerRequest
GetStoreItemsServerRequest.description: A store contains an array of references to items defined in one or more catalog versions of the game, along with the prices for the item, in both real world and virtual currencies. These prices act as an override to any prices defined in the catalog. In this way, the base definitions of the items may be defined in the catalog, with all associated properties, while the pricing can be set for each store, as needed. This allows for subsets of goods to be defined for different purposes (in order to simplify showing some, but not all catalog items to users, based upon different characteristics), along with unique prices. Note that all prices defined in the catalog and store definitions for the item are considered valid, and that a compromised client can be made to send a request for an item based upon any of these definitions. If no price is specified in the store for an item, the price set in the catalog should be displayed to the user.

GetTimeRequest.name: GetTimeRequest
GetTimeRequest.description: This query retrieves the current time from one of the servers in PlayFab. Please note that due to clock drift between servers, there is a potential variance of up to 5 seconds.

GetTitleDataRequest.name: GetTitleDataRequest
GetTitleDataRequest.description: This API is designed to return title specific values which can be read, but not written to, by the client. For example, a developer could choose to store values which modify the user experience, such as enemy spawn rates, weapon strengths, movement speeds, etc. This allows a developer to update the title without the need to create, test, and ship a new build. If an override label is specified in the request, the overrides are applied automatically and returned with the title data. Note that there may up to a minute delay in between updating title data and this API call returning the newest value.

GetUserAccountInfoRequest.name: GetUserAccountInfoRequest
GetUserAccountInfoRequest.description: This API allows for access to details regarding a user in the PlayFab service, usually for purposes of customer support. Note that data returned may be Personally Identifying Information (PII), such as email address, and so care should be taken in how this data is stored and managed. Since this call will always return the relevant information for users who have accessed the title, the recommendation is to not store this data locally.

GetUserBansRequest.name: GetUserBansRequest
GetUserBansRequest.description: Get all bans for a user, including inactive and expired bans.

GetUserDataRequest.name: GetUserDataRequest
GetUserDataRequest.description: Data is stored as JSON key-value pairs. If the Keys parameter is provided, the data object returned will only contain the data specific to the indicated Keys. Otherwise, the full set of custom user data will be returned.

GetUserInventoryRequest.name: GetUserInventoryRequest
GetUserInventoryRequest.description: All items currently in the user inventory will be returned, irrespective of how they were acquired (via purchasing, grants, coupons, etc.). Items that are expired, fully consumed, or are no longer valid are not considered to be in the user's current inventory, and so will not be not included.

GrantCharacterToUserRequest.name: GrantCharacterToUserRequest
GrantCharacterToUserRequest.description: Grants a character to the user of the type and name specified in the request.

GrantItemsToCharacterRequest.name: GrantItemsToCharacterRequest
GrantItemsToCharacterRequest.description: This function directly adds inventory items to the character's inventories. As a result of this operations, the user will not be charged any transaction fee, regardless of the inventory item catalog definition. Please note that the processing time for inventory grants and purchases increases fractionally the more items are in the inventory, and the more items are in the grant/purchase operation.

GrantItemsToUserRequest.name: GrantItemsToUserRequest
GrantItemsToUserRequest.description: This function directly adds inventory items to the user's inventories. As a result of this operations, the user will not be charged any transaction fee, regardless of the inventory item catalog definition. Please note that the processing time for inventory grants and purchases increases fractionally the more items are in the inventory, and the more items are in the grant/purchase operation.

GrantItemsToUsersRequest.name: GrantItemsToUsersRequest
GrantItemsToUsersRequest.description: This function directly adds inventory items to user inventories. As a result of this operations, the user will not be charged any transaction fee, regardless of the inventory item catalog definition. Please note that the processing time for inventory grants and purchases increases fractionally the more items are in the inventory, and the more items are in the grant/purchase operation.

ListUsersCharactersRequest.name: ListUsersCharactersRequest
ListUsersCharactersRequest.description: Returns a list of every character that currently belongs to a user.

LoginWithSteamIdRequest.name: LoginWithSteamIdRequest
LoginWithSteamIdRequest.description: If this is the first time a user has signed in with the Steam ID and CreateAccount is set to true, a new PlayFab account will be created and linked to the Steam account. In this case, no email or username will be associated with the PlayFab account. Otherwise, if no PlayFab account is linked to the Steam account, an error indicating this will be returned, so that the title can guide the user through creation of a PlayFab account. Steam users that are not logged into the Steam Client app will only have their Steam username synced, other data, such as currency and country will not be available until they login while the Client is open.

LoginWithXboxIdRequest.name: LoginWithXboxIdRequest
LoginWithXboxIdRequest.description: If this is the first time a user has signed in with the Xbox ID and CreateAccount is set to true, a new PlayFab account will be created and linked to the Xbox Live account. In this case, no email or username will be associated with the PlayFab account. Otherwise, if no PlayFab account is linked to the Xbox Live account, an error indicating this will be returned, so that the title can guide the user through creation of a PlayFab account.

LoginWithXboxRequest.name: LoginWithXboxRequest
LoginWithXboxRequest.description: If this is the first time a user has signed in with the Xbox Live account and CreateAccount is set to true, a new PlayFab account will be created and linked to the Xbox Live account. In this case, no email or username will be associated with the PlayFab account. Otherwise, if no PlayFab account is linked to the Xbox Live account, an error indicating this will be returned, so that the title can guide the user through creation of a PlayFab account.

ModifyItemUsesRequest.name: ModifyItemUsesRequest
ModifyItemUsesRequest.description: This function can both add and remove uses of an inventory item. If the number of uses drops below zero, the item will be removed from active inventory.

MoveItemToCharacterFromCharacterRequest.name: MoveItemToCharacterFromCharacterRequest
MoveItemToCharacterFromCharacterRequest.description: Transfers an item from a character to another character that is owned by the same user. This will remove the item from the character's inventory (until and unless it is moved back), and will enable the other character to make use of the item instead.

MoveItemToCharacterFromUserRequest.name: MoveItemToCharacterFromUserRequest
MoveItemToCharacterFromUserRequest.description: Transfers an item from a user to a character she owns. This will remove the item from the user's inventory (until and unless it is moved back), and will enable the character to make use of the item instead.

MoveItemToUserFromCharacterRequest.name: MoveItemToUserFromCharacterRequest
MoveItemToUserFromCharacterRequest.description: Transfers an item from a character to the owning user. This will remove the item from the character's inventory (until and unless it is moved back), and will enable the user to make use of the item instead.

RedeemCouponRequest.name: RedeemCouponRequest
RedeemCouponRequest.description: Coupon codes can be created for any item, or set of items, in the catalog for the title. This operation causes the coupon to be consumed, and the specific items to be awarded to the user. Attempting to re-use an already consumed code, or a code which has not yet been created in the service, will result in an error.

RedeemMatchmakerTicketRequest.name: RedeemMatchmakerTicketRequest
RedeemMatchmakerTicketRequest.description: This function is used by a Game Server Instance to validate with the PlayFab service that a user has been registered as connected to the server. The Ticket is provided to the client either as a result of a call to StartGame or Matchmake, each of which return a Ticket specific to the Game Server Instance. This function will fail in any case where the Ticket presented is not valid for the specific Game Server Instance making the call. Note that data returned may be Personally Identifying Information (PII), such as email address, and so care should be taken in how this data is stored and managed. Since this call will always return the relevant information for users who have accessed the title, the recommendation is to not store this data locally.

RemovePlayerTagRequest.name: RemovePlayerTagRequest
RemovePlayerTagRequest.description: This API will trigger a player_tag_removed event and remove a tag with the given TagName and PlayFabID from the corresponding player profile. TagName can be used for segmentation and it is limited to 256 characters

RevokeAllBansForUserRequest.name: RevokeAllBansForUserRequest
RevokeAllBansForUserRequest.description: Setting the active state of all non-expired bans for a user to Inactive. Expired bans with an Active state will be ignored, however. Returns information about applied updates only.

RevokeBansRequest.name: RevokeBansRequest
RevokeBansRequest.description: Setting the active state of all bans requested to Inactive regardless of whether that ban has already expired. BanIds that do not exist will be skipped. Returns information about applied updates only.

RevokeInventoryItemRequest.name: RevokeInventoryItemRequest
RevokeInventoryItemRequest.description: In cases where the inventory item in question is a "crate", and the items it contained have already been dispensed, this will not revoke access or otherwise remove the items which were dispensed.

RevokeInventoryItemsRequest.name: RevokeInventoryItemsRequest
RevokeInventoryItemsRequest.description: In cases where the inventory item in question is a "crate", and the items it contained have already been dispensed, this will not revoke access or otherwise remove the items which were dispensed.

SavePushNotificationTemplateRequest.name: SavePushNotificationTemplateRequest
SavePushNotificationTemplateRequest.description: Represents the save push notification template request.

SendCustomAccountRecoveryEmailRequest.name: SendCustomAccountRecoveryEmailRequest
SendCustomAccountRecoveryEmailRequest.description: PlayFab accounts which have valid email address or username will be able to receive a password reset email using this API.The email sent must be an account recovery email template. The username or email can be passed in to send the email

SendEmailFromTemplateRequest.name: SendEmailFromTemplateRequest
SendEmailFromTemplateRequest.description: Sends an email for only players that have contact emails associated with them. Takes in an email template ID specifyingthe email template to send.

SendPushNotificationFromTemplateRequest.name: SendPushNotificationFromTemplateRequest
SendPushNotificationFromTemplateRequest.description: Represents the request for sending a push notification template to a recipient.

SetFriendTagsRequest.name: SetFriendTagsRequest
SetFriendTagsRequest.description: This operation is not additive. It will completely replace the tag list for the specified user. Please note that only users in the PlayFab friends list can be assigned tags. Attempting to set a tag on a friend only included in the friends list from a social site integration (such as Facebook or Steam) will return the AccountNotFound error.

SetPlayerSecretRequest.name: SetPlayerSecretRequest
SetPlayerSecretRequest.description: APIs that require signatures require that the player have a configured Player Secret Key that is used to sign all requests. Players that don't have a secret will be blocked from making API calls until it is configured. To create a signature header add a SHA256 hashed string containing UTF8 encoded JSON body as it will be sent to the server, the current time in UTC formatted to ISO 8601, and the players secret formatted as 'body.date.secret'. Place the resulting hash into the header X-PlayFab-Signature, along with a header X-PlayFab-Timestamp of the same UTC timestamp used in the signature.

SetPublisherDataRequest.name: SetPublisherDataRequest
SetPublisherDataRequest.description: This API is designed to store publisher-specific values which can be read, but not written to, by the client. This data is shared across all titles assigned to a particular publisher, and can be used for cross-game coordination. Only titles assigned to a publisher can use this API. This operation is additive. If a Key does not exist in the current dataset, it will be added with the specified Value. If it already exists, the Value for that key will be overwritten with the new Value. For more information email helloplayfab@microsoft.com

SetTitleDataRequest.name: SetTitleDataRequest
SetTitleDataRequest.description: This API is designed to store title specific values which can be read, but not written to, by the client. For example, a developer could choose to store values which modify the user experience, such as enemy spawn rates, weapon strengths, movement speeds, etc. This allows a developer to update the title without the need to create, test, and ship a new build. This operation is additive. If a Key does not exist in the current dataset, it will be added with the specified Value. If it already exists, the Value for that key will be overwritten with the new Value.

UnlockContainerInstanceRequest.name: UnlockContainerInstanceRequest
UnlockContainerInstanceRequest.description: Specify the container and optionally the catalogVersion for the container to open

UnlockContainerItemRequest.name: UnlockContainerItemRequest
UnlockContainerItemRequest.description: Specify the type of container to open and optionally the catalogVersion for the container to open

UpdateBansRequest.name: UpdateBansRequest
UpdateBansRequest.description: For each ban, only updates the values that are set. Leave any value to null for no change. If a ban could not be found, the rest are still applied. Returns information about applied updates only.

UpdateCharacterDataRequest.name: UpdateCharacterDataRequest
UpdateCharacterDataRequest.description: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, while keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

UpdateCharacterStatisticsRequest.name: UpdateCharacterStatisticsRequest
UpdateCharacterStatisticsRequest.description: Character statistics are similar to user statistics in that they are numeric values which may only be updated by a server operation, in order to minimize the opportunity for unauthorized changes. In addition to being available for use by the title, the statistics are used for all leaderboard operations in PlayFab.

UpdatePlayerStatisticsRequest.name: UpdatePlayerStatisticsRequest
UpdatePlayerStatisticsRequest.description: This operation is additive. Statistics not currently defined will be added, while those already defined will be updated with the given values. All other user statistics will remain unchanged.

UpdateSharedGroupDataRequest.name: UpdateSharedGroupDataRequest
UpdateSharedGroupDataRequest.description: Note that in the case of multiple calls to write to the same shared group data keys, the last write received by the PlayFab service will determine the value available to subsequent read operations. For scenarios requiring coordination of data updates, it is recommended that titles make use of user data with read permission set to public, or a combination of user data and shared group data.

UpdateUserDataRequest.name: UpdateUserDataRequest
UpdateUserDataRequest.description: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, while keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

UpdateUserInternalDataRequest.name: UpdateUserInternalDataRequest
UpdateUserInternalDataRequest.description: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

UpdateUserInventoryItemDataRequest.name: UpdateUserInventoryItemDataRequest
UpdateUserInventoryItemDataRequest.description: This function performs an additive update of the arbitrary JSON object containing the custom data for the item instance which belongs to the specified user. In updating the custom data object, keys which already exist in the object will have their values overwritten, while keys with null values will be removed. No other key-value pairs will be changed apart from those specified in the call.

WriteServerCharacterEventRequest.name: WriteServerCharacterEventRequest
WriteServerCharacterEventRequest.description: This API is designed to write a multitude of different event types into PlayStream. It supports a flexible JSON schema, which allowsfor arbitrary key-value pairs to describe any character-based event. The created event will be locked to the authenticated title.

WriteServerPlayerEventRequest.name: WriteServerPlayerEventRequest
WriteServerPlayerEventRequest.description: This API is designed to write a multitude of different event types into PlayStream. It supports a flexible JSON schema, which allowsfor arbitrary key-value pairs to describe any player-based event. The created event will be locked to the authenticated title.

WriteTitleEventRequest.name: WriteTitleEventRequest
WriteTitleEventRequest.description: This API is designed to write a multitude of different event types into PlayStream. It supports a flexible JSON schema, which allowsfor arbitrary key-value pairs to describe any title-based event. The created event will be locked to the authenticated title.
